definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: Don't be a rat fink, Jack.
sentences.chinese: 不要可惡地打小報告，傑克。

sentences.english: Discourage gossip, and don't put people in the position of spying or reporting on each other.
sentences.chinese: 制止流言蜚語，不要讓人做臥底或者打小報告。

sentences.english: Daughter: A tattletale? Did you just call me a tattletale?
sentences.chinese: 你說我是打小報告的嗎？

sentences.english: Those who squeal on colleagues in returnforfavorsare the most hated intheoffice.
sentences.chinese: 辦公室裏最可恨的就是那些打小報告的人。

sentences.english: I told my teacher on Dolly for stealing my book.
sentences.chinese: 我跟老師打小報告說多莉偷我的書。

sentences.english: Danny always tattles on me when I do something wrong.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼總是在我做錯事時打小報告。

definition: to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to get straight to the point (idiom)
to make fun of/to seek diversion
to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
to make a terrible scene (idiom)/to throw a tantrum
pinyin: yi1 ku1 er4 nao4 san1 shang4 diao4

definition: white face/face painting in Beijing opera etc
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
